intro: Gibbaeum angulipes, commonly known as the angular gibbaeum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit and distinctive angular leaf shapes. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically during the cooler months. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid gardens.
